lead_paragraph: In a radio interview on Tuesday, Mr. LePage hinted at resignation. But in a later Twitter message, he seemed to have regained his spirit of defiance.

headline.print_headline: Maine Governor Appears to Back Off Hints of Resignation
headline.main: Paul LePage, Besieged Maine Governor, Sends Conflicting Signals Over Intentions

snippet: In a radio interview on Tuesday, Mr. LePage hinted at resignation. But in a later Twitter message, he seemed to have regained his spirit of defiance....
abstract: Maine's Republican Gov Paul R LePage walks back hints that he would resign, despite acknowledging outrage over his profanity-laden voicemail left for Democratic rival, and town hall meeting in which he said most drug dealers were black or Hispanic; Republican leaders will not join calls to convene special session to deal with LePage, while Democratic leaders say they will continue to call for his resignation.
